official-title.#text:
To direct the Administrator of the Environmental
		  Protection Agency to allow for the distribution, sale, and consumption in the
		  United States of remaining inventories of over-the-counter CFC epinephrine
		  inhalers.

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Distribution,
			 sale, and consumption of remaining inventories of over-the-counter CFC
			 epinephrine inhalers

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Administrator of
			 the Environmental Protection Agency

text.#text:
shall allow for the distribution, sale, and
			 consumption in the United States of remaining inventories of CFC epinephrine
			 inhalers manufactured pursuant to the exception for medical devices under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 604(d)(2) of the Clean Air Act

text.#text:
shall not take any enforcement action or
			 otherwise seek to restrict the distribution, sale, or consumption of such
			 inhalers on the basis of any Federal law implementing the Montreal Protocol;
			 and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
will not initiate an enforcement action relating to the
			 distribution or sale of any such inhaler occurring prior to August 1,
			 2013.

text.#text:
shall, in response
			 to any request of any distributor or seller of such inhalers, including any
			 such request pending on the date of the enactment of this Act, issue a No
			 Action Assurance Letter to the requesting party stating that the

Nothing in this
			 Act shall be construed to limit or otherwise affect the authority of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to ensure the safety and effectiveness of CFC epinephrine
			 inhalers to be distributed, sold, or consumed pursuant to this Act.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act

term.#tail:
means any epinephrine inhaler containing
			 chlo­ro­fluo­ro­car­bons that was manufactured and classified as
			 over-the-counter before January 1, 2012.
